glsa.title: ISC DHCP: dhcpd Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: dhcpd as included in the ISC DHCP implementation does not properly handle special conditions, leading to a Denial of Service.

background.p: ISC DHCP is the reference implementation of the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol as specified in RFC 2131.

description.p: Christoph Biedl discovered that dhcpd does not properly handle certain DHCP requests when configured both using "dhcp-client-identifier" and "hardware ethernet".

impact.p: A remote attacker might send a specially crafted request to dhcpd, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service (daemon crash).

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
